title: It was the costliest hurricane in U.S. history: Have we forgotten Katrina's lessons?
summary: Nearly 1,400 people died after Hurricane Katrina crashed into Louisiana and Mississippi. Most of the deaths were in New Orleans, which has had an uneven recovery in the past 20 years.

title: US food groups plead for relief from Trump’s tariffs
summary: Piecemeal approach leaves seafood and produce sectors fighting to win individual carve-outs

title: Is It Ever Legal—or Ethical—to Remove DRM?
summary: Digital Rights Management software makes it difficult to copy movies, music, ebooks, and games that you already own. There are ways around it, but breaking DRM opens up legal and ethical concerns.

title: Al Jazeera films in Gaza’s empty warehouse as Israeli-made famine deepens
summary: Al Jazeera's Ibrahim al-Khalili reports from inside the empty main UNRWA warehouse in Gaza City.

title: Israeli military uproots thousands of Palestinian olive trees in West Bank
summary: The Israeli army has uprooted 3,000 olive trees, citing security concerns, in the village of al-Mughayyir.

title: US halts work on almost finished wind farm because national security
